You guys‚Ä¶ I know this isn‚Äôt the most thrilling puzzle in the world ‚Ä¶ but it‚Äôs good basic practice for a number of skills. 

Please consider approving. üò∫

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

Goal section
* The note sounds a bit odd and confusing. Suggest to change it to:

An integer may appear more than once in [[array]] and each occurrence may belong to the same half or different halves.

For example, in {1 3 3 3 4 5}, the first two 3s belong to [[smallerNumbersHalf]] and the third 3 belongs to [[largerNumbersHalf]].

Input section
* Please add "space-separated" before "integers".

Output section
* Please change "num" to "howManyLines".

(Actually I'd prefer "numLines" or something like that.)

Constraints section
* Please either add or remove all the commas.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.

Done.
Thanks as always for all your very useful feedback
